rComments: Also, Environmental studies is an interdisciplinary field, but this straight, white, privileged man does not have a CLUE about the policy or sociological side of ENVS. Do not take unless you are science based, he will ruin your last quarter at UCSC. He probably cares more about Pumas than POC. Actually, he definitely does.

It  seems like people didn't like his ENVS 120 class because it was math based. It isn't Chris' fault, the course should be considered/changed to a different department, and not considered an ENVS class. Had him for Capstone 190 and he is very kind, understanding and willing to help.

1. he reminded me of Toby from The Office 2 Generally fair class 3 homework kind of hard but do-able 4 lectures and notes can be confusing but posted online 4 Wasn't terrible though 5 called students out for talking ( kinda give props) 6 somehow funny at times ... somehow 7 not bad of a class
His lectures are not clear at all. I did not learn anything. Were are the inspiring professors at?

His lectures are not clear at all. I really wanted to understand the information, but it's really difficult if you don't have the right math background and think a certain way. He definitely teaches to one type of learner, so be ready for some hard core confusing quantitative analysis. Did not enjoy and it it turned me off to a subject I like.

Great course if you're interested in on-the-ground population biology. However, ENVS120 should be moved to the EEB department, with calc. as a prerequisite (the math was dumbed down & not well-explained.) Excellent readings; wish Chris had quizzed on them as most seemed to skip them & thereby miss out on the best part of the course.

Uses the word um a lot, so it is hard to follow what he is saying most of the time. Skips steps, so it becomes even harder to follow. A lot of math, but real world applications to conservation. Take this class if you are interested in conservation, but don't expect it to be easy.

Great class if you actually want to be prepared for work in the field of ecology.  Not great if you are interested in conservation but not conservation biology. Wilmers presents lots of interesting material, and the guest lectures are great. I learned a LOT!

Exams are fair, although some tricky questions. Homework is difficult to do well on because each assignment is worth ~5 points but it ends up being 30% of your grade (same as each exam). Material is generally kept my attention, which is saying a lot for an 8 am class.

This teacher thinks he is super rad. His teaching style is undeveloped and lacking   in many ways. multiple choice questions that confuse and trick you into wrong answers. No midterm key posted so who knows what the right answers are? Doesn't go over homework or tests in class.

Tons and tons of confusing math.  Basically just studying population growth models.  Disorganized teaching and TAs.  The homework was  pretty difficult since it would sometimes be things we had never done in class.

Wilmers is a bit confusing at times, and not that helpful in office hours. Though cute and bubbly looking, his homework assignments are sometimes confusing as he doesn't go over the how to solve the problems in class, and they're worth 30% of your grade! Exams were pretty easy, but overall it was an okay class.

This was probably one of my favorite classes of all in the environmental studies program. Lectures were clear and to the point and the math was really simple. The book was a little rough to read, but gave you everything you needed. I would take this class again if I could!

Boring class, useless textbook. Doesn't answer questions well, not a clear teacher. Class description is deceptive - THIS CLASS IS ALL MATH. If you can't work with functions, DON'T TAKE IT. TA's don't even always know what is going on.

More math than expected (a calc class is useful). Chris is a great guy-hes very approachable and hasnt forgotten how hard it was to get where he is like lots of older prof. have. He wants students to learn and be as successful as he is. Kinda biased towards big predators but lectures were really informative even at 8am.  I learned a lot!
He is a bad teacher. Even if you go to his office hour, he does not help you, but stare.

I was really excited to take this class and I ended up not being very impressed. I learned some important things about conservation; the class is math based so expect it. I think since Chris is new he is still kinda awkward and unsure of himself, he is not a bad professor at all and explained everything pretty well.
